intro: Deiregynopsis tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered deiregynopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, herbaceous scent. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native range.
